text: David John Bryant (27 October 1931 â€“ 27 August 2020) was a British bowls player. A three-time World (outdoors) singles bowls champion (in 1966, 1980 and 1988) and was also a three-time World indoors singles champion (in 1979, 1980 and 1981) and a four time Commonwealth Games singles gold medalist. He was born in Clevedon, North Somerset, England. He was thought to be the greatest bowler of all time, winning 19 World and Commonwealth gold medals in total. Bryant died on 27 August 2020, aged 88. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Somerset
title: David Bryant (bowls)
